content.description: This is the climb that inspired the wall. Sadly, I moved away from the area before I could even get a single full day on it. It needs cleaning between bolts 6 and 7, and then it'll go! The grade feels 13ish so far, but I can't tell until it's sent. Message me if you're able to get this thing :)

Climb the initial balancy boulder problem through the first 3 bolts, and then milk the rest. Enjoy continuous V2-3ish boulder problems separated by jugs to the anchors. I could not get the giant boulder above and to the right of bolt 3 to move at all.
content.location: This shares the start of the black streak but heads up and right after the 3rd bolt.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt, and work your way up and over the roof. At each bolt, the climbing gets slightly easier. This is strenuous and enjoyable.
content.location: From the base of the crag, head up to the left underneath the roof. As soon as you can fully stand and not crouch after being underneath the roof, look up for the high first bolt.

climbs.name: Los Cuates
climbs.fa: K. C. Lewis and Nate Wilson

content.description: This has fun climbing with good rests between the difficult sections.
content.location: Currently (04/2021), it is the rightmost climb at the wall.

content.description: Scramble up to the left of the climb, and stickclip the very high first bolt just over the roof. Climb okay rock (tread lightly as I did not pull everything off here) up to the first bolt, and then enjoy the fun climbing to the anchors. This may be 5.11 if you are under 5' 7" or so. I might have added a couple more lead bolts to the lower section, but I still needed to check the rock quality and ran out of time before leaving the area. It's been climbed multiple times in its current condition.
content.location: From the base of the crag, look for the very high first bolt just over the roof. This is the climb to the left of the black streak.

content.description:
Climb the initial 3 bolts of

Bark at UPS Trucks

, and then work your way left when on the ledge. After clipping the fifth bolt, stay low, and utilize the good feet to avoid worse rock above before heading up. Beware of the flake at bolt 2. I was not able to remove it and felt it best to leave it. Myself and multiple friends have yarded on it without issue, but be cautious.
content.location: Look for the large flake up and left of bolt 2.

content.description: This has two boulder problems that are separated by some easy climbing. The first one is powerful, and the second one is thin. Beware of the flake at bolt 2. I was not able to remove it and felt it best to leave it. Myself and multiple friends have yarded on it without issue, but be cautious.
content.location: Look for the flake up and to the left of bolt 2.
